Convert (ash) dry weight to approximate wet weight

Source: R/dry2wet.R
dry2wet.Rd

This performs a simple conversion of ash dry weight to wet weight via Peters' approximate conversion.

Usage

dry2wet(dry, fctr = 5)

Arguments

dry

A vector of dry masses in kg

fctr

a factor between 3 and 10 to use in the conversion (as Peters specifies a range of possible conversions).

Value

The equivalent wet mass values in kg

References

Peters, R.H. (1983) The Ecological Implications of Body Size. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press (Cambridge Studies in Ecology), pp. 231–296. https://doi.org/10.1017/CBO9780511608551, Appendix Ia

Author

Francis Windram

Examples

v <- rnorm(20, 10, 2)
v
#>  [1] 10.936309 10.725903  7.390913 11.475553 13.777010  9.805110  8.128305
#>  [8]  9.968099  8.346422  6.975201 11.870726 10.352977 10.487371 13.247098
#> [15] 10.224076  9.732006  6.179825  9.441526  9.373108 12.134616
dry2wet(v)
#>  [1] 54.68154 53.62951 36.95456 57.37776 68.88505 49.02555 40.64153 49.84050
#>  [9] 41.73211 34.87600 59.35363 51.76489 52.43685 66.23549 51.12038 48.66003
#> [17] 30.89913 47.20763 46.86554 60.67308
